id.title: Id
id.description: ID of the event, assigned by Splunk Observability Cloud

metadata.title: MetaData
metadata.description: A map of key-value pairs created by Splunk Observability Cloud from event time series metadata for the ETS that the event belongs to. For example, alerts received from AWS contain metadata that describes the AWS instance that sent the alert.

properties.title: Properties
properties.description: A map of key-value pairs. The map can contain data sent to Splunk Observability Cloud in a POST v2/event request. It can also contain data added to the event from other sources.

sf_eventCategory.title: SFEventCategory
sf_eventCategory.description: A category that describes the event. The values are a set of enumerated types. Splunk Observability Cloud sets some values, while you can set others

sf_eventCreatedOnMs.title: SFEventCreatedOnMs
sf_eventCreatedOnMs.description: The date and time when the alert that creates the event was set, in *nix time in milliseconds.

timestamp.title: Timestamp
timestamp.description: The date and time of the event in *nix time in milliseconds. It's set by system.

sf_eventType.title: SFEventType
sf_eventType.description: A name for the event. You can specify this value when you send a custom event to Splunk Observability Cloud. Use it to uniquely identify custom events.For an event time series, this value is the analog of the metric name in a metric time series.

tsld.title: Tsld
tsld.description: Splunk Observability Cloud-assigned ID of the event time series (ETS) this event belongs to

url.title: Issue URL
url.description: URL to the issue in Jira

components.title: Components
components.description: The components related to this issue

creator.title: Creator
creator.description: The user that created the issue

created.title: Created At
created.description: The created datetime of the issue

updated.title: Updated At
updated.description: The updated datetime of the issue

resolutionDate.title: Resolved At
resolutionDate.description: The datetime the issue changed to a resolved state
